statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \sin x \cdot \sin 2 x \cdot \sin 3 x

step.tex: \text{Using trigonometric identities,}\\ \sin A \sin B = \dfrac{1}{2}\left[ cos(A-B) - cos(A+B) \right] \text{ and } \\ \sin A \cos B = \dfrac{1}{2}\left[ \sin(A+B) + \sin(A-B) \right]
\text{Using trigonometric identities,}\\ \sin^2 A+ \cos^2 A = 1 \text{ and}\\ \cos 2A = 2 \cos^2 A - 1 = 1 - 2 \sin^2 A \\

step.context: \begin{align} I &= \int\sin x\cdot\sin 2x\cdot\sin 3x \\ &= \int \dfrac{1}{4} [ \sin 2 x - \sin 6x +sin 4x] dx \end{align}\\ \text{Is the following correct}?
